file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 23-14-08-04 - CONFIG-2 - V/UHF FILTER - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL V/UHF FILTER - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH SINGLE V/UHF SYSTEM 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the V/UHF Filter. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT WITH SIN- 23-14-08-000-801-A V/UHF FILTER - REMOVAL GLE V/UHF SYSTEM AIRCRAFT WITH SIN- 23-14-08-400-801-A V/UHF FILTER - INSTALLATION GLE V/UHF SYSTEM EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-2 23-14-08 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 23-14-08-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH SINGLE V/UHF SYSTEM 2. V/UHF FILTER - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the V/UHF filter. (2) The V/UHF filter is installed in the rear electronic compartment. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 272 272DR Rear electronic compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Rear electronic compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) On the circuit-breaker panel, open the V/UHF XCVR circuit breaker and attach a DO- NOT-CLOSE tag to it. (3) Open access door 272DR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-003-A (1) Disconnect the electrical connectors (1) and (5) from the V/UHF filter (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 23-14-08 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Install protection caps on the disconnected electrical connectors. (3) Remove the screws (3) and washers (4) that attach the V/UHF filter (2) to the support. (4) Remove the clamps (6) from the V/UHF filter (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 23-14-08 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH SINGLE V/UHF SYSTEM V/UHF Filter - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONES 271 272 B DET. A 2 1. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR (TYPICAL) 2. V/UHF FILTER (TYPICAL) 3. SCREW (2) 4. WASHER (2) 5. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR (TYPICAL) 3 6. CLAMP (2) 1 SUPPORT (REF.) DET. B 1 ELECTRICAL BONDING (METHOD 6). 2 TORQUE: 5.6 N.m (50 lb.in) 3 TORQUE: 4.5 N.m (40 lb.in) EM145AMM231192A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 23-14-08 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 23-14-08-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH SINGLE V/UHF SYSTEM 3. V/UHF FILTER - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the V/UHF filter. (2) The V/UHF filter is installed in the rear electronic compartment. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - ELECTRICAL BONDING TEST - STANDARD PROCE- AMM TASK 20-13-21-700-801-A/200 DURES TYPES OF ELECTRICAL BONDING AND SURFACE AMM TASK 20-13-21-910-801-A/200 PREPARATION - STANDARD PROCEDURES AMM TASK 23-14-00-700-801-A/500 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 272 272DR Rear electronic compartment D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To torque available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Rear electronic compartment I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-003-A (1) Remove the protection caps from the electrical connectors (1) and (5). (2) Install the clamps (6) on the V/UHF filter (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 23-14-08 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL CAUTION: IF THE ELECTRICAL BONDING DEVICE DOES NOT MAKE UP A GOOD ELECTRIC CONDUCTIVE PATH, DAMAGE CAN OCCUR TO THE AIRCRAFT OR THE EQUIPMENT. (3) Do the electrical bonding procedures, method 6, on the screws (3), washers (4), clamps (6) and the support (AMM TASK 20-13-21-910-801-A/200). (4) Put the V/UHF filter (2) and clamps (6) in position at the support. (5) Install the screws (3) and washers (4) that attach the V/UHF filter (2) to the support. (6) Do the bonding test between the clamps (6) and aircraft ground (AMM TASK 20-13-21-700-801-A/200). (7) Connect the electrical connectors (1) and (5) to the V/UHF filter (2). (8) Use a torque wrench to torque the electrical connector (1) to 5.6 N.m (50 lb.in). (9) Use a torque wrench to torque the electrical connector (5) to 4.5 N.m (40 lb.in). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) Close access door 272DR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (2) On the circuit-breaker panel, close the V/UHF XCVR circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it. (3) Do the V/UHF Functional Test (AMM TASK 23-14-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 23-14-08 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
